frame.name: Opportunity
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> has a choice of whether or not to participate in some Desirable_event because of an <fen>Opportunity</fen>, a situation not completely under the <fen>Agent</fen>'s control and usually of a limited duration.
<ex>It would be pleasant in the <t>opportune</t> <fex name="Opportunity">absence</fex> of the clergyman to have a dance . <fex name="Desirable_situation">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Agent">Her</fex> <fex name="Opportunity"><t>opportunities</t></fex> <fex name="Desirable_situation">to apply to a good school</fex> are then limited .</ex>
<ex>Now was <fex name="Agent">their</fex> big <fex name="Opportunity"><t>chance</t></fex> ! <fex name="Desirable_situation">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Opportunity
FE.definition: <def-root>The situation during which the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen> is possible. For nominal LUs, this is generally in the second layer and contains the target. </def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The sentient agent that may or may not participate in the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Desirable_situation
FE.definition: <def-root>A situation or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> can participating in during the period of the <fen>Opportunity</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: opportunity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a favorable, circumstancial situation in which a situation can be pursued or attained.

lexUnit.name: chance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an exhaustible state of being able to pursue or attain a situation

lexUnit.name: opportune.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: presenting a situation in which someone is able to do something they want.

lexUnit.name: break.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an assiduously sought-after opportunity enabling fulfillment of a deep desire to participate in some particular life-path.
